titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Edward R. Becker Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Christy Tomecek

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 07:45

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The collection comprises the papers of Judge Edward R. Becker, who served both with the United States District Court of Eastern Pennsylvania and the United States Court of Appeals for the Third Circuit. His papers include correspondence, court memorandums, other court-related documents, speeches, subject files, programs and fliers, and newspaper and journal clippings, mainly related to cases over which he presided. Materials cover from 1943 to 2006, with the bulk from 1972 to 2006.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection comprises the papers of Judge Edward R. Becker, who served both with the United States District Court of Eastern Pennsylvania and the United States Court of Appeals for the Third Circuit. His papers include correspondence, court memoranda, other court-related documents, speeches, subject files, programs and fliers, and newspaper and journal clippings, mainly related to cases over which he presided. Materials cover from 1943 to 2006, with the bulk from 1972 to 2006.

There are some case materials included in the collection, including papers focusing on Matsushita Electric Industrial Co., Ltd. v. Zenith Radio Corp.. Much of the collection is focused on Becker's other judicial activities though, including his work with asbestos legislation, the Judicial Conference of the United States, and Third Circuit task forces on indigent litigants and the death penalty. Also included are plans for the timing of hiring law clerks in the federal courts, Continuing Legal Education (CLE) courses, especially on representing asylum-seekers in the federal courts, and research on legal concepts such as sentencing guidelines, class action lawsuits, and expert evidence in court hearings. There are also materials related to the Senate confirmation hearings for Justice Samuel A. Alito's nomination to the Supreme Court of the United States. Finally, a small but significant part of the collection includes papers related to Becker's different civic activities, including his work creating a Magna Carta exhibition in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The papers are arranged in eight series: I. Correspondence, 1970-2006. II. Judicial activities, 1970-2006. III. Subject files, 1970-2005. IV. Clippings, 1943-2006. V. Professional organizations, 1961-2006. VI. Civic organizations and educational programs, 1979-2006. VII. Personal papers, 1950-2005. VIII. Electronic files, 2003-2004.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Edward R. Becker Papers (MS 1929). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Series VIII, electronic files, is closed until processed. All other materials are open for research.

Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy of non-commercially produced items for their personal use should consult the ordering reproductions information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to Yale University for unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator(s) of this collection whether such works are at Yale or physically located elsewhere in the world. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Edward Roy Becker was born on May 4, 1933 in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. He attended the University of Pennsylvania for his B.A., graduating in 1954. He then received his LL. B. from Yale University in 1957. After graduation, he went into a private law practice, Becker and Becker. He worked in the practice for 13 years. In 1970, President Richard M. Nixon appointed Becker to the United States District Court of Eastern Pennsylvania. In 1982, President Ronald Reagan appointed Becker to the United States Court of Appeals of the Third Circuit. He went on to become the chief judge in 1998 and held that position until May 4, 2003. On that date (his 70th birthday), he was mandatorily assigned senior status. Becker continued to serve on the court until his death from prostate cancer on May 19, 2006. During his time as a judge, he was known to be an expert on antitrust law and use of expert evidence in trials. He also worked on many notable cases, including Matsushita Electric Industrial Co., Ltd. v. Zenith Radio Corp., Artway v. The Attorney General of the State of New Jersey and E.B. v. Verniero,Karcher v. May, United States et al. v. the American Library Association and Amchem Products, Inc. v. Windsor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I comprises correspondence Becker received, with occasional copies of letters that Becker sent.

Business correspondence mainly contains letters of thanks, related information to publications, and letters from lawyers and other judges relating to programs Becker was involved in as well as Becker's opinions and rulings. There are also several folders that are specifically focused on topics, including his work with the Administrative Office of the United States Courts, letters related to general civic causes, and letters sent only to Becker while he served at the Eastern District of Pennsylvania court and the Third Circuit Court of Appeals. For communications between multiple judges at each of these courts, please refer to the memoranda and other court communications folders located within Series II, Judicial activities. For more focused correspondence related to individual topics, individual professional organizations and individual civic causes, please refer to Series III, Series V, and Series VI respectively.

Personal correspondence includes thank you letters and notes, general letters of news between correspondents, and unofficial communications between different judges and between judges and law clerks. There are also several folders that are focused on specific topics, including congratulatory notes related to specific awards and letters to businesses.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series II contains materials from Becker's positions at the Eastern District of Pennsylvania Court and the Third Circuit Court of Appeals. Contents include materials related to his appointment to the Eastern District of Pennsylvania and the Third Circuit courts, case materials, court memoranda and other communications, legal opinions, and specific projects and events Becker was involved in. Series II also contains files pertaining to other activities not directly related to his work with those courts, including his work on asbestos litigation and a law clerk hiring plan. There are also materials related to an investigation by the Board of Censors of allegations by Bruce W. Praeger and Gerald M. Bonino against A. Charles Peruto involving Becker and others for misconduct. Finally, there is a section of photographs that depict court functions and include official court portraits, many of which are undated.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series III contains materials on topics that were of interest to Becker, much of it for research on cases, law journal articles, or speeches. Materials include clippings, internal court documents, correspondence, and interviews with Becker. Some of these subjects are directly related to cases and causes in which Becker was involved; others are more tangentially of interest.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series IV contains newspaper clippings, magazine clippings, printouts from websites, and law journals. A majority of the clippings concern Becker's cases or his areas of judicial interest. There are also several folders with articles about friends and colleagues of Becker, including obituaries and law journal tributes.

did.unittitle: Employee benefits/Employee Retirement Income Security Act (ERISA)
Internet pornography filters/Children's Internet Protection Act (CIPA)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series V contains materials related to different professional organizations in which Becker was involved. Many of these folders contain materials related to awards given by different organizations and planning committees of different sections within the organizations. There are also continuing legal education (CLE) course materials, both taught by Becker and taken by Becker. For other educational programs that Becker was involved with, please see Series VI, Civic Organizations and Educational Programs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series VI contains materials related to different civic organizations that Becker joined, as well as educational programs that he led with different institutions. For materials related to continuing legal education (CLE) courses, please see Series V. Materials include programs, correspondence and internal communications, minutes and agendas, newsletters, and legal documents.

did.unittitle: Fox Chase Cancer Center building expansion
Betsy Ross house strategic planning meeting
Independence Mall Business and Residents Coalition (IMBARC)
Independence Mall Business and Residents Coalition (IMBARC)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series VII contains materials that are personal in nature. These include photographs of family and friends, speeches given at funerals and events not related to judicial, professional, or civic activities, materials related to his family, and humorous materials. It also includes drafts of writings by others that Becker edited.

did.unittitle: Speeches and remarks made by others

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of nine optical discs including CD-R and DVD-R formats.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Electronic files are closed until processed.
